00008 =head3 full_partial_grader
00009 
00010 =pod
00011 
00012  ###########################################################
00013  #    full_partial_grader
00014  #    If the final answer is correct, then the problem is given full credit
00015  #    and a message is generated to that effect.  Otherwise, partial credit 
00016  #    is given for previous parts.
00017 
00018 =cut
00019 
00020 sub full_partial_grader {
00021     # Get the standard inputs to a grader:
00022         my $rh_evaluated_answers = shift;
00023         my $rh_orig_problem_state = shift;
00024         my %original_problem_state = %$rh_orig_problem_state;
00025         my %form_options = @_;
00026         #  The hash $rh_evaluated_answers typically contains:
00027         #      'AnSwEr0001' => 34, 'AnSwEr0002'=> 'Mozart', etc.
00028 
00029 
00030         # Evaluate these inputs using the "average problem grader"
00031         my ($rh_problem_result, $rh_problem_state) =
00032             &avg_problem_grader($rh_evaluated_answers,$rh_orig_problem_state,%form_options);
00033             
00034         my @answer_labels = keys %{$rh_evaluated_answers};
00035             my $count = @answer_labels;
00036 
00037     # Get the last label
00038 
00039 #       my $last_label = pop sort @answer_labels; # This is what I would like to do but sort seems to be trapped by Safe.pm
00040 
00041             my $last_label = ANS_NUM_TO_NAME(1); #usually AnSwEr0001
00042             
00043             foreach my $answer_label (@answer_labels) {
00044                 if ($answer_label gt $last_label) {$last_label = $answer_label;};
00045             }
00046 
00047         if (defined($rh_evaluated_answers->{$last_label}) and ${ $rh_evaluated_answers->{$last_label} }{score} == 1) {
00048                 $rh_problem_result->{score} = 1;
00049                 ${ $rh_evaluated_answers->{$last_label} }{ans_message} =
00050                   'You get full credit for this problem because this answer is correct.';
00051 
00052 
00053         $rh_problem_state->{recorded_score} = $rh_problem_result->{score} if
00054           $rh_problem_result->{score} > $rh_problem_state->{recorded_score};
00055         }
00056 
00057 
00058         # change the problem message
00059         $rh_problem_result->{msg} = 'You can earn full credit by answering just the last part.' if $count > 1;
00060         $rh_problem_result->{type} = 'full_partial_grader';  # change grader type
00061 
00062 
00063         # return the correct data
00064         if ($rh_problem_result->{score} == 1) {
00065             $rh_problem_state->{num_of_correct_ans} = $original_problem_state{num_of_correct_ans} + 1;
00066             $rh_problem_state->{num_of_incorrect_ans} = $original_problem_state{num_of_incorrect_ans};
00067         }
00068         else {
00069             $rh_problem_state->{num_of_correct_ans} = $original_problem_state{num_of_correct_ans};
00070             $rh_problem_state->{num_of_incorrect_ans} = $original_problem_state{num_of_incorrect_ans}+1;
00071      }
00072 
00073 
00074 
00075         # Return the results of grading the problem.
00076         ($rh_problem_result, $rh_problem_state);
00077 }
00078 
00079 =head3 custom_problem_grader_0_60_100(@rh_evaluated_answers,$rh_problem_state,%form_options)
00080 
00081 =pod
00082 
00083  ################################################################
00084  # custom_problem_grader_0_60_100
00085  #
00086  # We need a special problem grader on this problem, since we
00087  # want the student to get full credit for all five answers correct,
00088  # 60% credit for four correct, and 0% for three or fewer correct.
00089  # To change this scheme, look through the following mess of code
00090  # for the place where the variable $numright appears, and change
00091  # that part.
00092  # Also change the long line beginning "msg ==>", to show what will
00093  # appear on the screen for the student.
00094  #
00095  # To look at the problem itself, look for the boxed comment below
00096  # announcing the problem itself.
00097  ################################################################
00098 
00099 =cut
00100 
00101 sub custom_problem_grader_0_60_100 {
00102     my $rh_evaluated_answers = shift;
00103     my $rh_problem_state = shift;
00104     my %form_options = @_;
00105     my %evaluated_answers = %{$rh_evaluated_answers};
00106         #  The hash $rh_evaluated_answers typically contains: 
00107         #      'answer1' => 34, 'answer2'=> 'Mozart', etc.
00108        
00109         # By default the  old problem state is simply passed back out again.
00110     my %problem_state = %$rh_problem_state;
00111         
00112         
00113         # %form_options might include
00114         # The user login name 
00115         # The permission level of the user
00116         # The studentLogin name for this psvn.
00117         # Whether the form is asking for a refresh or
00118         #     is submitting a new answer.
00119         
00120         # initial setup of the answer
00121     my      $total=0; 
00122         my %problem_result = ( score => 0,
00123                 errors => '',
00124                 type => 'custom_problem_grader',
00125                 msg => 'To get full credit, all answers must be correct.  Having
00126  all but one correct is worth 60%.  Two or more incorrect answers gives a score 
00127 of 0%.',
00128                                );
00129 
00130 
00131     # Return unless answers have been submitted
00132     unless ($form_options{answers_submitted} == 1) {
00133     
00134     # Since this code is in a .pg file we must use double tildes 
00135     # instead of Perl's backslash on the next line.
00136         return(\%problem_result,\%problem_state);
00137     }
00138         # Answers have been submitted -- process them.
00139         
00140         ########################################################
00141         # Here's where we compute the score.  The variable     #
00142         # $numright is the number of correct answers.          #
00143         ########################################################
00144 
00145 
00146     my      $numright=0;
00147 
00148 
00149     $numright += ($evaluated_answers{'AnSwEr0001'}->{score});
00150     $numright += ($evaluated_answers{'AnSwEr0002'}->{score});
00151     $numright += ($evaluated_answers{'AnSwEr0003'}->{score});
00152     $numright += ($evaluated_answers{'AnSwEr0004'}->{score});
00153     $numright += ($evaluated_answers{'AnSwEr0005'}->{score});
00154 
00155 
00156     if ($numright == 5) {
00157         $total = 1;
00158     } elsif ($numright == 4) {
00159         $total = 0.6;
00160     } else {
00161         $total = 0;
00162     }
00163 
00164 
00165     $problem_result{score} = $total; 
00166         # increase recorded score if the current score is greater.
00167     $problem_state{recorded_score} = $problem_result{score} if $problem_result{score} > $problem_state{recorded_score};
00168 
00169 
00170         
00171     $problem_state{num_of_correct_ans}++ if $total == 1;
00172     $problem_state{num_of_incorrect_ans}++ if $total < 1 ;
00173         
00174         # Since this code is in a .pg file we must use double tildes 
00175     # instead of Perl's backslash on the next line.
00176     (\%problem_result, \%problem_state);
00177 
00178 
00179 }
00180 
00181 =head3 NOTE:
00182 
00183 =pod
00184 
00185  ################################################################
00186  # This problem grader custom_problem_grader_fluid 
00187  # was contributed by Prof. Zig Fiedorowicz,
00188  # Dept. of Mathematics, Ohio State University on 8/25/01.
00189  # As written, the problem grader should be put in a separate macro file.
00190  # If actually inserted into a problem, you need to replace a couple
00191  # of backslashes by double tildes.
00192  #
00193  # This is a generalization of the previous custom grader.
00194  # This grader expects two array references to be passed to it, eg.
00195  # $ENV['grader_numright'] = [2,5,7,10];
00196  # $ENV['grader_scores'] = [0.1,0.4,0.6,1]
00197  # Both arrays should be of the same length, and in strictly
00198  # increasing order. The first array is an array of possible
00199  # raw scores, the number of parts of the problem the student might
00200  # get right. The second array is the corresponding array of scores
00201  # the student would be credited with for getting that many parts
00202  # right. The scores should be real numbers between 0 and 1.
00203  # The last element of the 'grader_scores' array should be 1 (perfect
00204  # score). The corresponding last element of 'grader_numright' would
00205  # be the total number of parts of the problem the student would have
00206  # to get right for a perfect score. Normally this would be the total
00207  # number of parts to the problem. In the example shown above, the
00208  # student would get 10% credit for getting 2-4 parts right, 40%
00209  # credit for getting 5-6 parts right, 60% credit for getting 7-9 parts
00210  # right, and 100% credit for getting 10 (or more) parts right.
00211  # A message to be displayed to the student about the grading policy
00212  # for the problems should be passed via
00213  # $ENV{'grader_message'} = "The grading policy for this problem is...";
00214  # or something similar.
00215  ################################################################
00216 
00217 =cut
00218 
00219 sub custom_problem_grader_fluid {
00220     my $rh_evaluated_answers = shift;
00221     my $rh_problem_state = shift;
00222     my %form_options = @_;
00223     my %evaluated_answers = %{$rh_evaluated_answers};
00224         #  The hash $rh_evaluated_answers typically contains: 
00225         #      'answer1' => 34, 'answer2'=> 'Mozart', etc.
00226        
00227         # By default the  old problem state is simply passed back out again.
00228     my %problem_state = %$rh_problem_state;
00229         
00230         
00231         # %form_options might include
00232         # The user login name 
00233         # The permission level of the user
00234         # The studentLogin name for this psvn.
00235         # Whether the form is asking for a refresh or
00236         #     is submitting a new answer.
00237         
00238         # initial setup of the answer
00239     my      $total=0; 
00240         my %problem_result = ( score => 0,
00241                 errors => '',
00242                 type => 'custom_problem_grader',
00243                 msg => $ENV{'grader_message'}
00244                                );
00245 
00246 
00247     # Return unless answers have been submitted
00248     unless ($form_options{answers_submitted} == 1) {
00249     
00250     # Since this code is in a .pg file we must use double tildes 
00251     # instead of Perl's backslash on the next line.
00252         return(\%problem_result,\%problem_state);
00253     }
00254         # Answers have been submitted -- process them.
00255         
00256         ########################################################
00257         # Here's where we compute the score.  The variable     #
00258         # $numright is the number of correct answers.          #
00259         ########################################################
00260 
00261 
00262     my      $numright=0;
00263     my      $i;
00264     my      $ans_ref;
00265     my      @grader_numright = @{$ENV{'grader_numright'}};
00266     my      @grader_scores = @{$ENV{'grader_scores'}};
00267 
00268 
00269     if ($#grader_numright != $#grader_scores) {
00270         WARN("Scoring guidelines inconsistent: unequal arrays!");
00271     }
00272     for ($i=0;$i<$#grader_numright;$i++) {
00273       if($grader_numright[$i]>=$grader_numright[$i+1]) {
00274         WARN("Scoring guidelines inconsistent: raw scores not increasing!");
00275       }
00276       if($grader_scores[$i]>=$grader_scores[$i+1]) {
00277         WARN("Scoring guidelines inconsistent: scores not increasing!");
00278       }
00279     }
00280     if ($grader_scores[$#grader_scores] != 1) {
00281         WARN("Scoring guidelines inconsistent: best score < 1");
00282     }
00283 #    $i = 1;
00284 #    while (defined($ans_ref = $evaluated_answers{'AnSwEr'."$i"})) { 
00285 #      $numright += $ans_ref->{score};
00286 #      $i++;
00287 #    }
00288 
00289     # Answers have been submitted -- process them.
00290     foreach my $ans_name (keys %evaluated_answers) {
00291             $numright += $evaluated_answers{$ans_name}->{score};
00292     }
00293 
00294     
00295     for($i=0;$i<=$#grader_numright;$i++) {
00296       if ($numright>=$grader_numright[$i]) {
00297          $total = $grader_scores[$i];
00298       }
00299     }
00300 
00301     $problem_state{num_of_correct_ans}++ if $total == 1;
00302     $problem_state{num_of_incorrect_ans}++ if $total < 1 ;
00303     
00304     $problem_result{score} = $total; 
00305     
00306 # Determine if we are in the reduced scoring period and if the reduced scoring period is enabled and act accordingly
00307 #warn("enable_reduced_scoring is $enable_reduced_scoring");
00308 #warn("dueDate is $dueDate");
00309 
00310     my $reducedScoringPeriodSec = $reducedScoringPeriod*60;   # $reducedScoringPeriod is in minutes
00311     if (!$enable_reduced_scoring or time() < ($dueDate - $reducedScoringPeriodSec)) {   # the reduced scoring period is disabled or it is before the reduced scoring period
00312         # increase recorded score if the current score is greater.
00313         $problem_state{recorded_score} = $problem_result{score} if $problem_result{score} > $problem_state{recorded_score};
00314         # the sub_recored_score holds the recored_score before entering the reduced scoring period
00315         $problem_state{sub_recorded_score} = $problem_state{recorded_score};
00316     }
00317 elsif (time() < $dueDate) { # we are in the reduced scoring period.
00318         # student gets credit for all work done before the reduced scoring period plus a portion of work done during period
00319         my $newScore = 0;
00320         $newScore =   $problem_state{sub_recorded_score} + $reducedScoringValue*($problem_result{score} - $problem_state{sub_recorded_score})  if ($problem_result{score} > $problem_state{sub_recorded_score});
00321         $problem_state{recorded_score} = $newScore if $newScore > $problem_state{recorded_score};
00322         my $reducedScoringPerCent = int(100*$reducedScoringValue+.5);
00323         $problem_result{msg} = $problem_result{msg}."<br />You are in the Reduced Credit Period: All additional work done counts $reducedScoringPerCent\% of the original.";        
00324     }
00325     
00326     (\%problem_result, \%problem_state);
00327 }
